title: Bug 12398 - Accessibility problems
description: When I launch the Help view, I need to first click on one of the interactive areas, such as the banner with the tool buttons, the navigation frame, or the content frame, before it starts working. The tab key does not navigate through the Help view when it is launched. This prevents users from accessing the Help content via keyboard navigation.
OB: When I launch the Help view and press the tab key, it does not navigate to any of the interactive areas.
EB: The Help view should be starting in a way that allows immediate keyboard navigation. When I launch the Help view, pressing the tab key should navigate through the interactive areas, such as the banner, navigation frame, and content frame.
SR:
1. Launch the Help view on Win2K using the 20020326 build.
2. Attempt to navigate through the interactive areas using the tab key.
3. Notice that the tab key does not move the focus to any of the interactive areas in the Help view.
